Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Use pre-seeded database from repository - skip migrations if data exists

Problem: Installer was always deleting the database and running migrations,
even though the repository contains a ready-to-use database with all data.

Fixes:
- Removed database.sqlite from .gitignore (now tracked in repository)
- Added pre-seeded database.sqlite with default users and data
- Installer now checks if database has tables (users table)
- If database has data: uses it as-is, skips migrations and seeding
- If database is empty/missing: runs migrations and seeders

This makes installation faster and ensures consistent default data
across all installations.
